Bio

I am currently a 4th year Ph.D. student at Texas A&M University, advised by Dr. Shuiwang Ji, who leads the Data Integration, Visualization, and Exploration (DIVE) Lab. Before TAMU, I obtained my bachelorâ€™s degree in Electronic Engineering at Tsinghua University in July, 2021.

My research interest lies in deep learning, including (large) language model for science, trustworthy AI, graph DL analysis, out-of-distribution generalization, and causality. Currently, I am working on LLMs and their cross-combinations with geometric scientific tasks.

I am open to collaboration and actively seeking internship opportunities. If you're interested in working together or have opportunities available, please reach out to me!

News

    05/2024
    I am starting a new position as Research Intern at Genentech.
    05/2024
    Our paper TrustLLM: Trustworthiness in Large Language Models has been accepted as a position paper by ICML 2024.
    05/2024
    Our paper Graph Structure Extrapolation for Out-of-Distribution Generalization has been accepted by ICML 2024.
    01/2024
    Our paper Active Test-Time Adaptation: Theoretical Analyses and An Algorithm has been accepted by ICLR 2024.
    09/2023
    Our paper Joint Learning of Label and Environment Causal Independence for Graph Out-of-Distribution Generalization has been accepted to NeurIPS 2023.
    09/2022
    Our paper GOOD: A Graph Out-of-Distribution Benchmark has been accepted by NeurIPS on Datasets and Benchmark track.
    12/2021
    We won the 3rd place of Open Catalyst Challenge 2021.
